faqQuestion1: What are the benefits of investing in real estate?
faqAnswer1:
- Convenient payment options allow you to buy a property at the best price while it is still underconstruction. 
 - Due to the high demand, the value of real estate in North Cyprus rapidly increases. It means you will make a solid profit if you sell your property after some time. 
 -  The best way to boost your capital is purchasing a property at the project release and reselling it once the construction is completed. 
  Owning real estate in North Cyprus will allow you to benefit from a steady cash flow, while your property is rented and managed by the company. 
 The taxes you pay for the real estate in TRNC is much lower than elsewhere. Investing in real estate is boosting your capital protected against inflation.
faqQuestion2: Why do I need a real estate agency?
faqAnswer2: A reliable real estate agency is a beacon for foreign investors, because at every stage of the purchase you will always be supported, and a team of specialists will select the best investment solutions specifically for you.
faqQuestion3: What makes North Cyprus so special?
faqAnswer3:
An old belief and a proven fact: people on the island live more happily and peacefully. The average life expectancy is 78 years for men and 83 years for women. 
 - North Cyprus owns a culture filled with kindness and friendliness. Globalization and interculturalism come from the historical heritage of the island. 
 - In North Cyprus you are one step closer to nature, healthy lifestyle and organic fruit & vegetables. The use of pesticides is prohibited by law here. 
 - Every corner of the island is filled with history. Hundreds of historical landmarks make the evidence of an ancient heritage. 
 - And, of course, the azure waters of the Mediterranean, sandy beaches and a pleasant climate throughout the year attract many people.
faqAnswer4: Online purchases are very common nowadays. Your real estate agent will conduct an online inspection tour for you. Then you should pay the reservation deposit. After signing the POA a lawyer in TRNC will be authorized to act in your name for all the legal procedures. Thus, the whole process becomes pleasant and simplified for you.
faqQuestion5: What can I do in North Cyprus?
faqAnswer5:
- You can start or continue your education. North Cyprus is known for quality education in the internationally recognized universities at convenient prices. 
 - You can find a dream job. There are various opportunities of getting employment, especially if you know more than one language, open to learn more and work hard. 
 - Probably a perfect scenario is to work online. You may enjoy peaceful living on the island and working remotely. 
 - Start your own business. There is high demand for small businesses that are available for foreigners. A lawyer will help you organize a business in the TRNC.
faqQuestion6: How to get to North Cyprus?
faqAnswer6:
There are two ways - by air and by sea. Since there are no direct flights to North Cyprus, you will have to fly to Ercan International Airport through Turkish Istanbul, Antalya, Ankara, Izmir, Adana, etc. You don’t need a visa to enter the country. 
 The sea route also runs through Turkey. Ferries run daily from the cities of Tashuku and Mersin to Girne and Famagusta. Some of them carry not only passengers, but also their cars.

exploreHeader: North Cyprus is known for its beautiful sandy beaches. The turquoise sea is no less fascinating! The seashore of the island has been recognised as one of the cleanest in the whole Mediterranean.
exploreAbout: You’ll get the most exciting journey into the endless summer and profitable investment offers from Sun Republic. Our experts are happy to help you
northenCyprusContentOne: The Turkish Republic of North Cyprus is the full name of the country. It is located in the northern part of the island. It was founded in July 1974 and declared its independence in November 1984. Thus, the TRNC can be considered one of the youngest states on Earth. The territory of the republic is 3,355 square kilometers. Almost 400 thousand people live here. At the same time, about three million tourists visit the republic every year! First of all, they are attracted by the rich history, which has its roots in the Middle Ages, and mild Mediterranean climate. In summer the air temperature here ranges from 21°C to 37°C, in winter - from 5 °C to 15 °C. More than 300 days a year are sunny!
northenCyprusContentTwo: The capital of North Cyprus is Nicosia. Locals call it Lefkosha. Other major regions are Famagusta, Girne, Guzelyurt, Iskele. Due to its geographical location, Cyprus can be attributed to the countries of the Middle East, Western Asia and Europe. The southern coast of the TRNC has many kilometers of beaches, in the north - the Beshbarmak Mountains, which means Five Fingers in Turkish. The length of the massif, located parallel to the shore, is about 128 kilometers. Its highest point is 1,023 meters - Mount Selvili Tepe near Lapta.
northenCyprusContentThree: Let's tell you more about the three major cities of North Cyprus.
nocosiaContentOne: Olive groves, grape plantations and citrus orchards! This is what surrounds Lefkosha, the main city of Northern Cyprus. It is located at the foot of the Beshbarmak mountains at an altitude of 170 meters above sea level. It is the only capital in the world that belongs to two states. The "green zone" runs right through its center - an echo of the conflict between the Greeks and Turks. It happened in the mid-70s of the last century. Then Cyprus was divided into southern and northern parts. Southerners call their capital Nicosia.
nocosiaContentTwo: The city was founded in the VII century BC and called Ledra. For almost three millennia, it has repeatedly migrated from the hands of one ruler to another. Who has not been here for many years! The troops of Alexander the Great, the army of King Richard the Lionheart of England and the soldiers of the Ottoman Empire. This explains Lefkosha's rich historical heritage. There are  Cyrenian Gate, the Selimiye Mosque, the Venetian Column, the Buyuk Khan Caravanserai and the Church of St.Nicholas. Tourists have a lot to see here.
nocosiaContentThree: Today Lefkosha is the largest city in North Cyprus. There are several universities, shopping and entertainment complexes and many restaurants. On the streets of Lefkosha you can see buildings in European, Greek and Turkish styles.
KyreniaContentOne: This beautiful port city is located on the shores of the Mediterranean Sea. Girne is the tourist Mecca of North Cyprus. It is almost 2.5 thousand years old. From the first days of its history it has been a tasty morsel for conquerors from different parts of the world. At one time, the Egyptian pharaohs, the Romans, the Byzantines, the Venetians, the Turks, and the British ruled here. This explains the large number of ancient stone buildings, castles and fortresses. In one of them, the Cyrenian fortress, dating from the XVI century, there are museums of shipwrecks and torture.
KyreniaContentTwo: The mountains that block Girne from the rest of the island have created a truly paradise of nature. There are many sandy beaches here, and the sea pleases the eye with its azure color. Dozens of large and small yachts moored at the pier of the Kyrenian harbor create a romantic picture of peace. Cozy cafes, restaurants and souvenir shops add it.
KyreniaContentThree: Lovers of fun will not be bored here. Concerts and festivals are held in Girne. It is also quite legal to place bets in the casino. Hundreds of hotels have been built for guests, including five-star hotels. Colleges and universities are located in the city.
FamagustaContentOne: The city on the east coast of Cyprus was founded by the Egyptians in the III century BC and named Arsinoe. They were attracted by the deepest harbor of the island and the cleanest sandy beaches. The city received the name Famagusta in the XII century AD. At various times the city was conquered by the Assyrians, Persians, Romans, Venetians, Ottomans. It affected the look of the historical part of Famagusta. Here you will see the ruins of ancient fortresses, medieval churches, colorful mosques and temples.
FamagustaContentTwo: The Greeks and Turks also fought for the city. The last conflict occurred in the summer of 1974. After that, a buffer "green zone" appeared here. It divided the island into the Greek South and the Turkish North. It also passes through Famagusta, on the coast it ends in the Varosha area. Dozens of fashionable hotels once operated here, world-class stars bought up real estate. Now this area is called a ghost town. In August 1974 all its inhabitants left their homes within a day. For almost half a century the entrance to the territory of Varosha was closed to absolutely everyone. A small part of it was opened to tourists in the fall of 2020.
FamagustaContentThree: Famagusta attracts not only tourists. In 1979 the first university in Cyprus, the Eastern Mediterranean University, was opened in the city. Students from all over the world study there.

propertyTourContentOne: Many people who are thinking about buying property abroad, looking for a villa or apartment by the sea, always want to see the objects they like in person and talk to developers. But how to combine a trip to Northern Cyprus, where you want to buy property, with vacation, sightseeing, leisure and business meetings with developers?
propertyTourContentTwo: "Sun Republic" will help you choose the best property close to the sea, shopping, university, school or kindergarten. Our qualified staff will be happy to answer any questions you may have, help you choose the most convenient flight dates and give you detailed advice
whatisorientationContentOne: Reconnaissance tour - is a relatively new type of tourism and type of pre-sales service, which allows you to combine in a trip at once leisure and professional help with the choice of apartments or houses. And also includes viewing all your favorite properties, communicating with developers and acquaintance with the culture of Northern Cyprus
whatGoesOnStudy: Who goes on a study tour and what does the trip include?
whatGoesOnStudyContent:
At Sun Republic we gather different groups of people for such tours to Northern Cyprus. It may be 2-4 people, to small groups of 8-12 people, or even more. 
 With this type of tour we provide the most individual approach to each person, offering a plan of visiting the island, which includes meeting with developers and exploring the best residential complexes, as well as visiting private beaches, sightseeing, and any activities - from individual tours to golf and yachting.
whatKindHolidays: What kinds of holidays are available in North Cyprus?
whatKindHolidaysContent:
Despite the small size of the island, it offers many interesting ways to spend time: 
 
 Water sports: diving, kitesurfing, windsurfing and more 
 Golf 
 Yachting 
 SPA-programs in the best salons on the island 
 Individual hiking programs to the most picturesque places of the island 
 Tasting of local cuisine, visiting the production of wine, cheese 
 Horse races and horseback riding 
 Exotic Fishing
averageProperty: The average property tour lasts 3-4 days. Usually this is enough time to get acquainted with the island and the property of interest, and if you decide to buy - to sign the contract and registration.
whatToKnowMore: Want to know more about the study tour? Our experts are ready to tell you about all the details in organizing a trip to Northern Cyprus and offer a complete "turnkey" option.
ClimateContent: North Cyprus averages 340 days of sunshine annually. In winter it is warmer than in Europe and even in Turkey.
ResidencePermitContent: Property owners in North Cyprus can apply for a residence permit  regardless of the amount of investment.
SafetyLowCrimeContent: North Cyprus has the lowest crime rate among countries whose population is under five million people.
RisingInvestmentContent: Every year the cost of a square meter of property increases by 30%. The yield from renting real estate in foreign currency is up to 12%, and the price of housing increases by 100-300% from the start of sales to the commissioning of the facility.
DisclosureIncomeContent: Information on cash receipts is not disclosed to third parties. The banking sector of North Cyprus is isolated from international financial institutions.
EverybodyWelcomeContent: Citizens of most countries can enter North Cyprus without an advance visa. In addition, almost every guest of the island has the right to purchase real estate here.
